title: Artist Talk with Kollective Fusion
body:
Artist Talk with Kollective Fusion: Coinciding with the 50th year of Hip Hop, APLs first hip-hop-themed poster exhibition will be traveling from the Austin History Center to multiple branches throughout the Austin Public Library. The hip hop poster artist, founder of KLCTIVE and Creative Director at Industry Print Shop, Bobby Dixon will share his insights and creation ideas of his work with attendees. Come mingle with the artist and other hip hop art enthusiasts!

About the Exhibit
The Bobby Dixon Kollective Fusion Poster Exhibition: Celebrating Hip Hop Through Artistry and Design

This exhibition celebrates the 50th Anniversary of Hip Hop through the work of local artist and designer Bobby Dixon of Kollective Fusion (AKA KLCTVE Design + Illustration)

March 26, 2024 - May 23, 2024

Ruiz Branch - 1600 Grove Blvd.

About the Artist

For two decades, Bobby has produced screen-printed concert posters for local, national, and international acts. The posters in this exhibition showcase Bobby's artistic design in works created for prominent hip-hop performers that have graced Austin stages.

title: Star Weaving with One Million Stars Texas
body:
One Million Stars Texas is part of One Billion Stars, a global star weaving project that invites communities around the world to weave these symbols of light, courage and solidarity for violence free communities. Building community connections and creating a safe sense of belonging is the heart of our star weaving movement.

In this workshop we will share information about the One Million Stars Texas project and participants will learn how to weave an 8 pointed star. Star weaving is a medium level weaving technique and is a great activity to share with friends and family. All supplies will be provided.

Adults only please.

title: Tween Kawaii Club: Flower Octopus Clay Sculpture with Rita Wang
body: Join us for a fun-filled afternoon of creativity at the Tween Kawaii Club event! Get ready to unleash your artistic side and learn the art of clay sculpting with the talented artist, Rita Wang. During this hands-on workshop, you will discover the secrets behind creating adorable flower octopus sculptures. For ages 9-12.

title: Native American Heritage Month Celebration
body: November is National Native American Heritage Month. Spicewood Springs Branch has invited Dr. Aaron Pyle and the Aztec Dance Company - Mitotiliztli Yaoyollohtli to share about Native Americans and Tribes around the central United States. Dr. Pyle, a member of the Choctaw Nation of Oklahoma, will feature storytelling and flute playing. Mitotiliztli Yaoyollohtli is a family of Danzantes and relatives from the Dallas area that feature and teach Danza steps while conveying a deep sense of cultural understanding. Coloring activities and snacks will be provided in this afternoon of celebration!

title: Native American Heritage Month Celebration
body: November is National Native American Heritage Month. Menchaca Road Branch has invited Dr. Mario Garza and the Aztec Dance Company - Mitotiliztli Yaoyollohtli to share about Native Americans and Tribes around the central United States. Dr. Garza, an elder of the Miakan/Garzas Band of the Coahuiltecan, a state-legislature-recognized tribe of Texas, will discuss eye opening facts about Native innovations and ancient contributions. Mitotiliztli Yaoyollohtli is a family of Danzantes and relatives from the Dallas area that feature and teach Danza steps while conveying a deep sense of cultural understanding. Coloring activities and snacks will be provided in this afternoon of celebration!

title: Weeknight Cinema: Workers' Walkouts
body: In turn-of-the-twentieth century Turin, an accident in a textile factory incites workers to stage a walkout. But it's not until they receive unexpected aid from a traveling professor that they find a voice, unite, and stand up for themselves. This historical drama by Mario Monicello is a beautiful and moving ode to the power of the people, brimming with humor and honesty.

title: Science Monday
body: Come for an hour of themed STEAM stations or science design challenges the whole family will enjoy. Create, build, solve, and learn more about the natural world around us.

title: Weeknight Cinema: Workers' Walkouts
body: Written and directed by John Sayles, this wrenching historical drama recounts the true story of a West Virginia coal town where the local miners' struggle to form a union rose to the pitch of all-out war in 1920. When Matewan's miners go on strike, organizer Joe Kenehan (Chris Cooper, in his film debut), arrives to help them, uniting workers white and black, Appalachia-born and immigrant, while urging patience in the face of the coal company's violent provocations.

title: Discover Your Family’s Story
body: Join us for a genealogy seminar at the Pleasant Hill Public Library! Discover your family's history and learn how to trace your roots. This staff led workshop will teach you how to use Austin Public Library’s online genealogy resources to explore your family history. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced researcher, this event is perfect for anyone interested in exploring their ancestry. Our knowledgeable instructor will guide you through the fascinating world of genealogy, providing tips and tricks to help you uncover your family's past. Don't miss this opportunity to connect with your heritage and uncover the stories that make you who you are. Mark your calendars and join us for Discover Your Family's Story at the Pleasant Hill Public Library!

title: Library Escape Room: Mysteries of the Deep
body:
Dive into the free thrilling Library Escape Room: Mysteries of the Deep, where you'll unravel ancient secrets and solve puzzles in a group. 

While attempting to contact the Great Old One Cthulhu, Professor Freeborn and four of his colleagues have been ripped through a portal to another reality. Now, trapped in the Professor’s office, you and your fellow students must sort through the esoteric clutter to solve the puzzles and find the incantation that will close the portal and save our reality from utter destruction.

Eventbrite tickets for Library Escape Room: Mysteries of the Deep are live. Sign up today with family and friends aged 13+ or go for a mystery group in the same time slot—maximum group size is 10. If all tickets are sold out, you are welcome to come to the library and wait in case there are no shows.

title: Audubon Society Presentation
body: Have you ever visited a local lake and wondered what ducks and wading birds you are seeing? Have you noticed that the number and diversity of species changes throughout the year? Ducks and herons are big and easier to see than songbirds, and identifying them on your own can be satisfying and fun. Some birds that look like ducks, but aren’t ducks, will be included.

title: The Crafty Adult: Dreamcatchers are Not Your Aesthetic
body:
Originating with the Ojibwe of the North, Dreamcatchers are an item of spiritual and cultural significance to Native Peoples across North America. Today, corporations and companies around the world have appropriated these sacred hoops in an effort to profit from our traditions. People have forgotten the stories and meanings behind Dreamcatchers and use them in inappropriate ways. Join Twin Oaks and the Austin History Center for this workshop, we will share the stories, spiritual significance, and meanings behind the Dreamcatcher and you will learn respectfully how to make one for yourself or a loved one.

Registration is required.  Supplies will be limited.

title: Let's Play Go!
body: Are you a big fan of board games? The game of Go, also known as Weiqi, I-go or Baduk, is one of the oldest strategy games in the world! Join this information session offered by Austin Go Club to learn all the rules from a Go Master in two hours.

This program will be conducted in Chinese Mandarin and Cantonese.

title: Dig It: Gardening in Texas
body: This November, Austin Davenport will be teaching us all about soil health! Join us in learning to improve your garden yield and the health of your plants by tending to your soil! Compost, worms, fertilizer, mulch, mushrooms and more ! Transform your soil to grow you most resilient and productive garden, yet!

title: Dinovember Party
body: Join us for a storytime celebration of all things dinosaurs! We've got crafts and learning activities for everyone from Eorapter enthusiasts to Stegaoaurus stans. Learn all about carnivorous dinosaurs with local paleontologist BK Bones at 1PM. Recommended for ages 3 and up.

title: Dinovember Party

title: Dinovember with Paleontologist BK Bones
body: Join us for an all-ages show with local paleontologist BK Bones! Learn all about exciting Meat-Eating Dinosaurs. Learn more about your favorites, as well as carnivorous dinos that might be new to you, as well as all their special adaptations that helped them thrive on prehistoric Earth.

title: CANCELLED - Well Read Sistahs and Chicas

title: Heartdrum Author Panel for Native American Heritage Celebration
body: BookPeople and Austin Public Library welcome Heartdrum authors Kim Rogers, Brian Young, Laurel Goodluck, Dawn Quigley, and Cynthia Leitich Smith to celebrate Native American Heritage Month as part of APL's full day of music, food and more celebrating the rich heritage of Native Americans.

title: Teen Writing workshop with Brian Lee Young
body: Join author and filmmaker Brian Young in a special limited-size writing workshop, held in Teen Central, our dedicated teen area at the Central Library, as part of our Native American Heritage Month Celebration. Brian will be focusing on revising scenes with goals oriented characters as he leads attendees through guided writing instruction, and shares his knowledge of the craft with teen writers who attend. Brian is an enrolled member of the Navajo Nation, and also represents Heartdrum, an imprint of HarperCollins by Native American authors. Space is limited, so please reserve your spot by claiming a ticket!

title: Adobe for All: 8- Bit Pixel Portrait
field_subtitle: Learn how to make 8-bit Pixel Portraits!
body:
Learn how to make 8-bit Pixel Portraits using Adobe Photoshop.

A﻿dobe for All is a program series created by the Innovate Digital Makerspace at the Central Library. This program was created to teach the basics of various Creative Cloud Applications through short tutorials. The classes are beginner-friendly and open to all ages!

We have 13 Desktop computers, but you are more than welcome to bring your own device if you have Adobe Photoshop already installed.

If tickets are sold out, don't be discouraged, feel free to show up and learn!

title: Celebrate Diwali at the Oak Hill Library!
body: Celebrate Diwali at your Library! Join us for a Mini-Ramleela, Ravan’s  Katha Storyteller Performance, DIY card making, and select prizes -  including signed Diwali book giveaways! In partnership with the local non-profit, Peerbagh, who are driven by a single mission—to ignite the spark of imagination and inspire creative confidence while encouraging inclusive storytelling inspired by South-Asian culture and storytelling.

title: Homeschool Community Brainstorm
body:
Homeschool Families are invited to come help the Youth Central Librarians brainstorm ways to support your families in the coming year. Librarians from Children's and Teen Services at Central will be present and want to hear from you about how we can serve you in the coming year. Refreshments and fun community-building activities will be provided. 

Questions or can't make it but want to share ideas? Reach out to kathleen.houlihan@austintexas.gov and suzan.nyfeler@austintexas.gov

title: Tabletop Gaming Night NAHM Edition: A Board with Books Program
body: Celebrate International Games Month and Native American Heritage Month with two TTRPGs designed by Native artist Mercedes "Cibby" Acosta: "what happened?" and "Los Arboles." Recommended for teens and adults due to the horror themes in the games.

title: Amy Bluemel: Native American Storyteller
body:
Join us for an afternoon of Storytelling with Amy Bluemel! Amy is a registered member of the Chickasaw Nation and will bring a large variety of Native artifacts such as hides, arrows, tomahawks, bead work, rattles, dance shakers, literature, and more. Performing in regalia, she will share some of her language, history, culture, and stories. 

¡Únete a nosotros para una tarde de narración con Amy Bluemel! Amy es un miembro registrado de la Nación Chickasaw y traerá una variedad de artefactos nativos como cueros, flechas, tomahawks, trabajo de cuentas, sonajería, agitadores de baile, literatura y más. Actuando en regalia, compartirá parte de su idioma, historia, cultura e historias.

title: Movie Night: Smoke Signals
body:
Join us on Wednesday November 15th at 6pm at Milwood Branch Library for a screening of Smoke Signals (1998) in honor of Native American Heritage Month. Smoke Signals was the first feature film written, directed, and produced by Native Americans. The film won the Filmmaker’s Trophy for director Chris Eyre, a member of the Cheyenne and Arapaho Tribal Nations, and the Audience Award at the 1998 Sundance Film Festival. The film was also selected for preservation in the National Film Registry for being “culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant". 

The runtime is 89 minutes. The event is free and open to the public.

title: Virtual Graphic Novel Book Club
body:
In November, we'll be reading Lore Olympus volume 1 by Rachel Smythe. Persephone has finally convinced her mother to let her move to Olympus to start college after growing up in the mortal realm. Now she's thrown into a world of gods and goddesses, and when she meets Hades, god of the Underworld, she's really gets herself into trouble. Volume 1 includes chapters 1 through 25 of the Webtoons comic.

Registration closes at noon on Monday, November 13.

Please register on Eventbrite to attend. Using your registration info, your book club moderator will email you an invitation to this virtual event. Need a refresher on joining a Microsoft Teams meeting? Check out these instructions. Other questions? Ask a Librarian.

title: Butterfly Festival/Festival de las Mariposas
body:
Wing your way to the Southeast Branch Library for our first ever Butterfly Festival, a family event where we will be celebrating the butterfly and its connections to Dia de los Muertos. Take a look at our butterfly habitat where painted lady butterflies are growing, make butterfly crafts, and learn about the butterfly life cycle with Texas Master Naturalists. Then, enjoy crafts and the performance ArtSmart: Skulls and Butterflies, by Ambray Gonzales. 

 

¡Vente de volada a la Biblioteca Southeast para participar y disfrutar de nuestro primer Festival de las Mariposas!

En este evento familiar celebraremos la existencia de las mariposas y aprenderemos sobre su conexión con la celebración del Día de Los Muertos.

Ven a observar cómo crecen en nuestro hábitat de mariposas y aprende sobre su ciclo de vida a través de los Maestros Naturalistas de Texas.

Disfruta también de manualidades y del espectáculo ArtSmart: Calaveras y Mariposas, a cargo de Ambray Gonzalez.

title: Canceled - A performance and lecture by Aaron Pyle
body:
Aaron Pyle is a Native American flute player, storyteller, and lecturer whose presentations interweave music with traditional and contemporary tales and is well suited for youth and adult audiences.

Aaron Pyle is a member of the Choctaw Nation of Oklahoma and an active contributor in the Central Texas intertribal community. He holds a Bachelor of Arts in Music and Anthropology from Texas State University, a Master of Science in Social Work from the University of Texas at Austin, and a PhD in Educational Leadership and Policy from the University of Texas at Austin. His research focuses on Native American experiences in education.

title: Yoga with Katherine
body:
Join us for some mindful movement on the 1st Thursday of each month. 

This class will focus on strengthening and stretching the body, cultivating a calm and centered mind and breathing. We will make use of blocks, straps, the wall, and chairs to support healthy alignment and relaxation. Students with all levels of experience are welcome!

Please bring a thin yoga mat if you have one and wear comfortable clothes. The Library will have a few mats to share.

title: Basic Spanish
body:
Come learn Spanish with the Austin Public Library! This free, virtual class intended for beginners. Topics covered include greetings, basic conversations, the weather, telling time, numbers, Spanish for travel, and commonly used verbs.

Register at the link provided or contact Alicia Niwagaba for more information.

title: Digital Nature Walk
body:
Join us for Digital Nature Walk, where we combine nature and AI software to identify plants and animals found around the Central Library!

Limited number of iPads are available, we will be using Apple Camera's which are embedded on all Apple iPads and iPhones. We will also be using an application called Merlin Bird ID, which is a free application you can download on Google play and Apple App Store.

This program is brought to you by APL Innovate, Austin Public Library’s digital makerspace for content creators and other creatives.

title: Cryptids Unleashed! An Afternoon with Cryptozoologist Ken Gerhard
body: Join renowned cryptozoologist Ken Gerhard at the Cepeda branch library as he delves into the weird world of cryptids. Mr. Gerhard has published six books on cryptozoology, and has appeared on Travel Channel, Science Channel, National Geographic, Syfy, Animal Planet, and the History Channel series The Proof Is Out There.

title: Teen Banned Camp: Bookmark Art and Trivia

body:
Join us for free popcorn, lemonade, and an afternoon movie!  This month follow Miguel in his journey to the Land of the Dead as he discovers the truth behind his family history in Pixar/Disney's Coco, rated PG. 

Played in English with subtitles in Spanish.

¡Únase a nosotros para recibir palomitas, limonada y una película gratis! Este mes sigue a Miguel en su viaje a la Tierra de los Muertos mientras descubre la verdad detrás de su historia familiar en Coco de Pixar/Disney, con clasificación PG.

En inglés con subtítulos en español.

title: Lounge Movie Night: T﻿he Magic of Méliès
body:
Austin Public Library's Innovate Digital Makerspace invites you to get inspired by films featuring trailblazing artists that paved the way for artistic creation.

T﻿he Magic of Méliès is a documentary about George Méliès, who was one of the first to film fictional narratives, and is regarded as the inventor of special effects in movies. His films were among the first to use such techniques as double exposure, stop-motion, and slow motion.

This recurring event will happen every third Thursday of the month at the Innovation Lounge, stay tuned to see what amazing films we will be presenting next.

Also, find out how you can recreate similar art using our Digital Makerspace, located on the 5th floor of the Austin Central Library!

title: Talk Time
body:
Improve your English conversation. ¡Mejore su conversación en inglés!

Talk Time is a program for English conversation practice with other English language learners and English speaking volunteers. No registration is necessary. The program is open to any adult who speaks some English and wants an informal and safe place to practice with others.

Participe en Talk Time: Hablemos Inglés, un programa gratis de La Biblioteca Pública de Austin, donde usted puede venir a conversar en inglés y así practicar y sentirse más seguro. No es necesario registrarse. Este programa se ofrece a cualquier adulto que hable algo de inglés y que quiera practicarlo con otros en un lugar informal y sin presiones.

title: Mushrooms, Worms and Birds: A Roots and Wings Event
body:
Join us for a day celebrating mushrooms, worms and birds! Central Texas Mycological Society will host their scarecrow mushroom cultivation workshop and bucket tek workshop. Don't forget to register for the bucket tek workshop! Enjoy a presentation by the Travis Audubon Society to learn which native plants attract birds to your yard along with a fun craft activity to take home. Then discover how red wiggler worms help the soil and composting with hands on activities presented by Keep Austin Beautiful throughout the day.

10am-2pm – Keep Austin Beautiful

Wormy Composting

We will bring our vermi-compost bin and youth will have the opportunity to explore the wonders of our red wiggler worms!

10am – Central Texas Mycological Society

Lo-tek Mushroom Cultivation Scarecrow Workshop

Join us for a workshop that combines a bunch of spooktacular things we love about fungi! First, fun with fungi while learning basics of mycoremediation growing mushrooms outdoors, and creating a scarecrow to protect your garden. Since it’s okay to decay, we will be building scarecrow together that will decompose over the fall and winter with the help of recycled oyster mushroom blocks.

11am – Travis Audubon Society

Gardening for Birds with Native Plants

Do you want to attract more birds to your yard or neighborhood greenbelt? In this talk you will find out how native plants help birds, and get acquainted with several easy to grow native plants that appeal to birds and other wildlife.

12pm - Central Texas Mycological Society

Bucket tek Workshop (Registration Required)

Learn how to recycle mushroom blocks to build healthy soil, sequester carbon, increase water retention and divert organic matter from the waste stream. *The Bucket tek Workshop requires registration and for you to bring your own container.* Registration Link here: AUSTIN: Mushrooms, Worms, and Birds! A Roots & Wings Event — Central Texas Mycological Society (centraltexasmycology.org)

title: Homeschool Day at the Bullock Museum
body:
Enjoy a FREE day full of discovery and learning at the Bullock Museum for homeschool families.

  • 10:30 a.m. – 11:30 a.m. Participate in a special paid class with Central Texas Mycological Society to learn about how mushrooms grow and to make your own mushroom-growing block using recycled materials.
  • 11:00 a.m. and 12:00 p.m. Join Austin Public Library for a fungi-themed story time.
  • 12:30 p.m. – 1:30 p.m. Join award-winning author Alisha Gabriel to learn all about fungi by dissecting a plush mushroom, building your own fungi-journal, and going on an exciting fungi scavenger hunt to document some unusual fungi you can find in your own neighborhood.

title: Waterloo Greenway Morning Glories
body:
Join us for an unBOOlievably fun and spooky celebration of Halloween and Dia de los Muertos. Read the Room will lead an exploration of bravery and facing our fears through storytelling, movement, and music.

Little hands get hands-on fun at wonder-filled workshops focused on literacy, bilingual storytelling, music and dance, cultural learning, and nature play.

Each week features a different style of play from our partners at Texas Book Festival, Austin Public Library, Armstrong Community Music School, Read the Room, Creative Action, and the Emma S. Barrientos Mexican American Cultural Center.

title: HEB Free First Sunday at the Bullock Museum
body:
Enjoy FREE exhibition admission all day during H-E-B Free First Sundays, held the first Sunday of every month. Activities are from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Families can explore the Story of Texas through three floors of exhibitions that showcase and tell the history of artifacts from around the state.

  • 10:30 a.m. and 11:30 a.m. Join Austin Public Library for storytime and hands-on activities
  • 11:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. Enjoy traditional Puerto Rican dances performed by Puerto Rican Folkloric Dance
  • Learn about Puerto Rican culture through interactive activities, including a Puerto Rican traditional vejigante-inspired mask craft

title: Lone Star Zine Fest
body:
It’s back and it’s spookier than ever! The 7th annual Lone Star Zine Fest will have over 100 vendors slinging zines, comics, art and much more! Plus zinemaking, treats, and door prizes! Visit the Austin Public Library's booth at the Blue Genie Art Bazaar | 6100 Airport Blvd Austin, TX.

The event is FREE and for all ages! Costumes encouraged.

For more information, please visit www.lonestarzinefest.org

title: South Asian Festival
body: Come celebrate Austin’s South Asian culture with talented community artists and dancers! There will be a traditional dance demonstration, Henna artist, art gallery, samosas and much more!

title: Garden Storytime-Roots & Wings
body:
We’re excited to be hosting an official Roots & Wings Festival Event! The Roots & Wings Festival is held from Wednesday, October 18, through Saturday, November 5, and is a community-wide celebration honoring Arbor Day and Monarch Appreciation Day in Austin. Join us in celebrating the Roots & Wings Festival on October 21st with Garden Storytime.

Enjoy a special Roots & Wings storytime, a butterfly craft, and the opportunity to take home your own caterpillar to raise into a butterfly!
field_event_summary: Enjoy stories, songs, and crafts in the garden for this outdoor storytime! Remember to bring appropriate clothing, sunscreen, and bug-spray as necessary.

title: Central Library Sing-a-long: Holiday Big Sing with Conspirare
body: Grab your friends and family and celebrate the season with Conspirare. Craig Hella Johnson will conduct the Holiday Big Sing, in which the audience is the choir, with help from the Conspirare Symphonic Choir. Come sing your holiday favorites together. No singing experience is needed! Wear your holiday sweater and Santa hat to celebrate or just come as you are.

title: APL After Dark: Creature Feature
body:
Join us at Central Library after hours for an evening where adults 21+ enjoy all things classic horror films. APL After Dark is an adults-only (21+) evening in the Austin Central Library that explores a fun theme. Come out for entertainment, games, storytelling, music, drinks & more — inside your favorite library!

T﻿his October, join us to explore the world of Creature Features, a genre of classic horror films and TV shows filled with every manner of creepy crawler, oversized reptiles, and monsters from swaps, black lagoons, haunted seas, and space. Experience the magic of holographic effects with the Innovation Lab. Spice up your Halloween costume with SFX makeup workshops. Meet new scaly friends with Austin Reptile Show and learn about toxic plants. Get ready for your closeup in the Quick Draw Photo Booth and toss back popcorn and candy like at the movies. Discover nature gone wild in the Central Library!

In partnership with the Emma S. Barrientos - Mexican American Cultural Center the Austin Public Library is hosting a series of free workshops and classes designed to promote holistic wellness for adults in our community.

title: Weeknight Cinema: Disappearing Dangers
body: The owner of a coal mining operation, falsely imprisoned for fratricide, takes a drug to make him invisible, despite its side effect: gradual madness.

title: Weeknight Cinema: Disappearing Dangers
body: Trapped in a violent, controlling relationship with a wealthy scientist, Cecilia Kass escapes in the dead of night and disappears into hiding. But when her abusive ex commits suicide and leaves her a generous portion of his vast fortune, Cecilia suspects his death was a hoax.

title: Weeknight Cinema: Disappearing Dangers
body: A scientist finds a way of becoming invisible, but in doing so, he becomes murderously insane.

title: Waterloo Morning Glories
body: Celebrate Hispanic Heritage Month at Waterloo Park! While it’s important to read and share Latinx and Hispanic stories all year long, September and October are dedicated to celebrating and amplifying Latinx/Hispanic voices. Join us as we explore bilingual books, music, crafts, and interactive readings that feature Austin’s Latinx and Hispanic community!

title: 2nd Annual Districtwide Austin ISD Showcase
body: Visit the library's booth at the Austin ISD Showcase! Enjoy music and dance performances, play with robots, get a free haircut and school supplies, and learn about Austin ISD programs and resources. Hang out with awesome mascots and prepare for a day filled with endless excitement.

title: Bookmobile Stop

title: Film Screening of Gefilte Fish by Yuliya Lanina
body:
Animation film screening of Gefilte Fish by Yuliya Lanina. This film recommended for mature audiences only. 

The animation is dedicated to Lanina grandmother's family who were killed by the Nazis along with 1.6 million Ukrainian Jews. This project sheds light on how survivors’ trauma carries over to next generations, aided by reluctance of the families to deal with uncomfortable dynamics. 

yuliyalanina.com/gefilte-fish

Find more information about Yuliya Lanina's exhibit here.

title: Banned Camp Zine Night: Cartoneras
body:
Come make your very own cartonera book using recycled materials.

Learn about this artistic, cultural, and social literary movement that originated in Argentina, spreading to countries throughout Latin America and beyond, connecting communities and promoting literacy using salvaged materials.

Materials provided.

En este programa, Ud hará su propio libro cartonera utilizando materiales reciclados.

Aprenderá sobre este movimiento literario artístico, cultural y social que se originó en Argentina y se extendió a países de América Latina y más allá, conectando comunidades y promoviendo la alfabetización utilizando materiales recuperados.

Se proporcionarán materiales

title: The Crafty Adult: Talavera Pottery Painting

title: Virtual Graphic Novel Book Club Jr.
body:
In November, we'll be reading Four Eyes by Rex Ogle & Dave Valeza. In this graphic memoir, the author shares his experience dealing with bullies at school, having no friends, and suddenly needing glasses.

Registration closes at noon on Wednesday, November 15.

title: Virtual Graphic Novel Book Club Jr.
body:
We know there are many graphic-novel-devouring tweens out there, so come join Leslie and Heather in discussing books each month. In October, we'll be reading Scurry by Mac Smith. A group of house mice - long reliant on humans' messiness - are faced with a long, strange winter when all the humans disappear and a dark rain begins to pour from the sky. With traps and danger around every corner, the colony fears the worst until rumors of a wrecked truck full of supplies bring them a little hope.

Registration closes at noon on Wednesday, October 18.

title: Banned Camp Film Fest
body: Join us for a family screening of a film based on a banned book as part of our Banned Camp Film Festival. Bring your tissues for a Bridge to Terabithia, and stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges. Recommended for ages 9 and up.

title: Baila! A Collection of Latin Dance Lessons
body:
Latin dance reveals the ancient traditions of Latino culture as well as its history of emigration and adaptation. Offering an outlet for rhythmic expression and flowing movements, Latin dance incorporates a number of styles, including bachata, cumbia, reggaetón, salsa, and merengue.  Come watch and learn with Corazon Latino at the Library.

La danza latina revelan tradiciones ancestrales de esta cultura y habla también de su  historia de emigración y adaptación. Esta danza incorporan diversos estilos que incluyen la bachata, la cumbia, el reggaetón, la salsa y el merengue, los cuales ofrecen un conducto  para  expresiones rítmicas y movimientos fluidos. Le invitamos a las demostraciones y clases de bailes latinos ofrecidos en la Biblioteca a través de la organización Corazon Latino.

Este programa es presentado en inglés. Si necesita un intérprete, por favor solicítelo en este número: 512-974-7400.

title: Citizenship Clinic: Information Session
body: Attend an information session to learn how to apply for US Citizenship. Attorneys from American Gateways will be present. You will receive a worksheet that outlines the documents and information you need to prepare for your N-400 application for naturalization.

title: Myths, Magik & Monsters
body:
Interested in Folklore and Mythology? Come share your favorite stories or characters with us. From Medusa to Lechuza, we are talking about Folklore and Myths from any tradition.

There is deeper meaning at the heart of every myth. Myths are more than just simple stories, they are sacred tales that try to explain the world and reflect universal concerns of birth, death, the afterlife, the origins of a people, the nature of good and evil and our place in nature.

Folklore is the expression body of culture shared by a particular group of people; it encompasses the traditions common to that culture, subculture or group. This includes oral traditions such as tales, proverbs and jokes.

field_subtitle: All welcome to this teen art exhibition
body:
All ages are welcome to join us for the reception of Nuestro Mundo (Our World) Teen Exhibit where we will showcase the artwork created by Austin's youth during MexicARTE's summer camp. We will have a screen printing activity, snacks and music by DJ Hierba Malita! 

In Nuestro Mundo, students focused on building and strengthening their community through art and education. Led by museum art educators, participants identified a change they wish to see in the world. Each student created an infographic poster using silkscreen printing technology. These posters communicate to the public the necessity of social change in an area of importance to our young participants.

title: Canceled - Talk Time
body:
Talk Time is a program for English conversation practice with other English language learners and English speaking volunteers.

  • No registration is necessary.
  • The program is open to any adult who speaks some English and wants an informal and safe place to practice with others.

Participe en Talk Time: Hablemos Inglés, un programa gratis de La Biblioteca Pública de Austin, donde usted puede venir a conversar en inglés y así practicar y sentirse más seguro.

  • No es necesario registrarse.
  • Este programa se ofrece a cualquier adulto que hable algo de inglés y que quiera practicarlo con otros en un lugar informal y sin presiones.
field__this_event_main_image_alt: Talk Time in Speech Bubbles with two mouths speaking the bubbles

title: Sketch Crew
body:
Grab your sketchbook and your favorite pencil and come to the Terrazas Branch and join the Sketch Crew.

Every first Thursday from 5:30-7:30 PM we get together at Terrazas to hang and sketch with other artists or anyone who is interested in getting into drawing, in other words, all skill levels are encouraged to attend. Drawing amongst your peers, you can pick up new techniques and ideas, build community, have conversation and make friends. Join us and be welcome.

title: Museum Day

title: Making Comics Workshop
body: Join us for the Making Comics workshop! We will be practicing our drawing, composition skills and panel layout. We will talk about how to come up with a story line and develop a character, and discuss other topics related to writing and drawing Comics. Local Comics Artist/self-publisher, Adam Kobetich will discuss the techniques he has learned from his experience as a Comics artist.

body: Join us for free ESL Classes every Thursday morning from October 5 - December 14 (No class November 23). Registration is required.

body: Learn to play chess from an experienced teen volunteer. They will lead games, share tips, and improve your skills. Last Saturdays from 1-4 pm.

title: Seed Gathering
body: Join us to learn about the Austin Public Library Seed Collection, gardening, and sustainable living while we process seed donations for the Seed Collection.

title: Grow Green: Wild About Plants!
body: Grow Green is a City of Austin water quality education program that encourages people to make landscaping choices that benefit the environment, emphasizing using the right plant in the right place philosophy. Central Texas climate has many extremes, so the plants have to be Texas tough! Understanding what makes them capable of surviving, the regional environment and the importance of site-specific conditions is essential to making informed plant selection decisions.

title: Adventures in 3D
field_event_summary: Take your imagination to the next dimension... the third dimension! For Hispanic Heritage Month, participants will construct their own Mexican fantastical folk creature, or alebrijes, using templates, 3D pens and filament provided.

title: Hispanic and Latinx Heritage Month Storytime
field_event_summary: We will celebrate Hispanic and Latinx Heritage with wonderful stories, songs, and crafts that represent this proud cultural heritage. Join us for reading, singing, playing, and more!

title: Rhythm and Familia Dance Class
field_event_summary: Old and young alike will get their bodies moving while learning a simplified version of a Latin American dance! This community event is presented by the National Association of Hispanic Nurses (NAHN) Austin Chapter.

title: Inclusive Low-Stimulation Storytime
field_event_summary: This inclusive, abbreviated storytime is designed for early learners who benefit from reduced sensory input, including children with special needs. Experience literacy through sensory exploration and play.

title: Get Crafty: Guatemalan Barrilete Gigantes Kites
body:
Join us for this special hands-on workshop to make traditional Guatemalan Barrilete Gigantes kites to celebrate el Dia de los Muertos (Day of the Dead). We will be making Mini Guatemalan Kites and learning about the ancient art form. 

Acompáñenos en este taller práctico sobre los tradicionales barriletes gigantes guatemaltecos que se construyen para celebrar el Día de los Muertos (Day of the Dead.) Haremos barriletes en miniatura y aprenderemos sobre esta forma de arte ancestral.

title: Get Crafty: Banned Books Lockets and Magnets
body:
Throughout history, many books in schools and libraries around the country have become cases for contention surrounding controversial topics in a variety of iconic pieces of literature.

Join us at the Windsor Park Branch Library as we explore the meaning of banned books in America and create lockets, magnets and buttons that represent books that have been banned throughout history in America.

title: Banned Book Printmaking
body: Learn to use foam block printing techniques to make a bookmark or bag with a banned book theme.

title: Horror Book Club
field_subtitle: A House at the Bottom of A Lake
body: Calling all lovers of horror, suspense, and the supernatural to have a discussion about the books that keep us awake at night.

field_event_summary: Create pixel art from plastic beads the fuse together when melted with an iron. Cree pixel art con cuentas de plástico que se fusionan cuando se derriten con una plancha.

title: Canceled - Virtual Talk Time hosted by Menchaca Road Branch
Movie Night: The Nightmare Before Christmas!
body: Is it a Halloween movie? Is it a Christmas movie? Come tell us what you think at the Southeast Branch Library as we get spooky, get cozy, and watch The Nightmare Before Christmas! Snacks and activities provided.
field_event_summary: Learn about leadership through movies with Community Youth Development 78744 and Austin Southeast Branch Library! Children with their adults, teens, and families welcome. Snacks provided.

title: Banned Camp Film Fest
body: Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. Are You There God. . . It's Me, Margaret, and stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges. Recommended for ages 13 and up.

title: Kids Create
body: September: Make Your Own Stickers

title: Kids Create
body: Drop by the library and make a craft while you search for books, movies and music. We've got paper crafts, easy sewing and more fun projects for the whole family. We provide the supplies; you provide the creativity. Program length is approximately 1 hour.

title: Get Crafty: Guatemalan Weaving
body:
Join us in a fantastic world of color, as we discover the legend of Guatemalan weaving and create our own woven bookmark.

Acompáñenos a un fantástico mundo de colores mientras descubrimos el legendario tejido guatemalteco y tejemos nuestro propio marcador de libros.

title: Barking Book Buddies: Read to Hank!
body: Divine Canine's certified volunteer teams with trained therapy dogs ready for kids to read to them! This program improves children’s reading and communication skills by employing a powerful method: reading to a dog.

title: Arts Alive
body: Milwood Branch will be host to local artists as they work on their projects in real time. Come in and meet the local community and talk to the artists about their process and what inspires them to create. Make your own abstract watercolor painting to take with you!

title: Teen Banned Camp: Representation Matters
body: OutYouth invites all teens who are passionate about the power of books and the importance of representation to join us for an inspiring presentation. Discover how to create your own banned book club.

title: Banned Camp Film Fest
body: Join us for a family screening and art project to celebrate Banned Books Week. Speak for the trees and come by and watch The Lorax. This book was banned in 1989 from a California Public school for "brainwashing children". This movie is rated PG and is recommended for ages 9 and up.

title: Banned Camp Film Fest
body: Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. Tonight we are showing Are You There God. . . It's Me, Margaret, a film based on Judy Blume's beloved teen classic. Film is rated PG-13 and recommended for ages 13 and up.

title: Banned Camp Film Fest
body: Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. We will watch the 2019 documentary about the beloved, yet controversial children horror series Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark. Movie is rated PG-13 and is recommended for ages 13 and up.

title: Blackout Poetry Craftstation
body: Learn about blackout poetry and make your own poem at our Banned Books Craftstation!

title: Canceled - Bookmobile Stop
body: Visit our bookmobile at the Northwest Recreation Center. Sign up for your library card and check out books, movies, audio books and more!

title: Virtual Graphic Novel Book Club
field_subtitle: Killadelphia Volume 1: Sins of the Fathe
body:
In October, we'll be reading Killadelphia Volume 1: Sins of the Father by Rodney Barnes and Jason Shawn Alexander. When a cop returns home to Philadelphia to bury his detective father, he begins unraveling a mystery that leads to horror and... an undead president?

Registration closes at noon on Monday, October 9.

title: Virtual Graphic Novel Book Club Jr.
field_event_summary: We know there are many graphic-novel-devouring tweens out there, so come join Leslie and Jessica in discussing books each month. In August, we'll be reading the first book in the 5 Worlds series, The Sand Warrior, by Mark Siege.

title: Teen Banned Camp Film Fest: Persepolis
body: This event is for teens 13-18 only. Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. Persepolis, and stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges.

title: Banned Camp Make and Watch
body: Join us for a family screening and art project to celebrate Banned Books Week. Prepare to travel across time and space with A Wrinkle in Time (2018), based on the award winning novel that was banned in some places for "promoting the occult." This movie is rated PG and runs for 109 minutes. Recommended for ages 9 and up.

title: Banned Camp Film Fest
body: Join us for a family screening of a film based on a banned book. Ready your spy gear for Harriet the Spy, and stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges. Recommended for ages 9 and up.

title: Banned Camp Film Fest
body: Join us for a family screening of a film based on a banned book. Ready your spy gear for Harriet the Spy, and stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges. Recommended for ages 9 and up.

title: Banned Camp Film Fest
body: Join us for a screening of a film based on a banned book. Howl (2010) follows the life and art of poet Allen Ginsberg, including the obscenity trial surrounding his famous poem Howl. Movie is rated R.

title: Banned Books Silent Reading Party
body: Celebrate your freedom to read at our silent reading party. Bring your favorite book to read or borrow one of our headsets and listen to George Orwells' 1984 or Shirley Jackson's The Lottery on audiobook. Snacks and beverages will be provided while supplies last.

title: Teen Banned Camp: Banned Book Bookclub
body: This program is for teens age 13-18 only. Read any banned book and come discuss it with other teen book fans! We'll discuss what everyone read and why those titles were banned or challenged, and then everyone can share book titles that we should add to our TBR piles!

title: Teen Banned Camp: Banned Bookclub Networking & Support
body: This event is for teens 13-18 only. Want to learn more about what other teens are doing around book bans happening in Texas, or share your experience getting involved? Join us in this virtual meetup for teens co-sponsored by the Children's Defense Fund, BookPeople, the Library and facilitated by SEAT (Students Engaged in Advancing Texas).

title: Banned Camp Pre-Screening Trivia
body: Join us for Banned Books trivia before a screening of A Wrinkle in Time. Compete for a prize and learn more about your freedom to read. Stick around after for the movie screening and art project.

title: Tween Code Club
body:
Learn to code games and animation in Scratch in this three-week series on Sundays 1-2:30 at the Little Walnut Creek branch.

Utilizing the Rasberry Pi Code Club curriculum, students will be introduced to the Scratch coding platform, create fun projects, and explore coding concepts such as scripts, loops, operators, and variables.  No experience is necessary, all levels are welcome. Please ensure you register for all three sessions in a series.

Aprenda a codificar los juegos y las animaciónes en Scratch en esta serie de tres semanas los domingos 1-2:30 en Little Walnut Creek Branch.

Utilizando el plan de estudios de Rasberry Pi, los estudiantes serán introducidos en la plataforma de codificación de Scratch, crearán proyectos divertidos y explorarán conceptos de codificación como scripts, bucles, operadores y variables. No es necesaria experiencia, todos los niveles son bienvenidos. Asegúrese de registrarse para las tres sesiones de una serie.

title: Talk Time
body:
Talk Time is a program for English conversation practice with other English language learners and English speaking volunteers.

  • No registration is necessary.
  • The program is open to any adult who speaks some English and wants an informal and safe place to practice with others.

Participe en Talk Time: Hablemos Inglés, un programa gratis de La Biblioteca Pública de Austin, donde usted puede venir a conversar en inglés y así practicar y sentirse más seguro.

  • No es necesario registrarse.
  • Este programa se ofrece a cualquier adulto que hable algo de inglés y que quiera practicarlo con otros en un lugar informal y sin presiones.

title: The Crafty Adult: Decorating Sugar Skulls
body:
Decorate a sugar skull and learn about how these skulls are used in traditional altars to celebrate Day of the Dead. The class will be bilingual (Spanish). Adults only.

Decora una calavera de azúcar y aprende cómo se usan estas calaveras en los altares tradicionales para celebrar el Día de muertos. La clase será bilingüe (Español). Sólo para adultos.

title: Dig It! Gardening in Texas
field_subtitle: Everything Onions, Garlic & All The Rest
body: This October, Austin Davenport will be teaching us all about alliums! Join us in learning to grow this incredible culinary genus of plants, and come ready to get your hands dirty, because each attendee will get to leave with some garlic to grow!

title: Teen Fix-It Clinic: Sewing
body:
Teens, come learn basic sewing skills and repair damaged clothes with the help of Fix-It Clinic Volunteers! Bring clothing or other textiles you would like to fix. After a short sewing project to help you get the basics down, you will have the opportunity to work with volunteers to repair your items. All other materials provided. Registration required for this event. 

Adolescentes, vengan a aprender habilidades básicas de costura y a reparar ropa dañada con la ayuda de los voluntarios de Fix-It Clinic! Traigan ropa u otros textiles que quieras arreglar. Después de un breve proyecto de costura para ayudarte a aprender lo básico, tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar con voluntarios para reparar tus artículos. Todos los materiales para reparar son proporcionados. Se requiere inscripción para este evento.

body:
Please join us on the 2nd Friday of each month to review great books and to have meaningful conversations.

This program is offered in a hybrid format:

  • In-person session: 5:30pm.
  • Virtual session: 6pm through Zoom 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Únase a nosotros el segundo viernes de cada mes para revisar excelentes libros y tener conversaciones amenas y significativas.

Este programa es ofrecido en formato híbrido:

  • Sesión presencial: 5:30PM.
  • Sesión virtual: 6pm a través de Zoom

title: Get Crafty: Voodoo Doll Felties!

title: Dove Springs Oral History Workshop
body:
Do you live or have you lived in Dove Springs? Are you interested in community history but not sure how to help preserve it? Learn how to conduct oral history interviews in a FREE workshop presented by the Austin History Center and Southeast Branch Library!

At this workshop you will:

  • Enjoy FREE lunch
  • Hear about resources at the Austin History Center
  • Learn the basics of oral history projects
  • Practice interviewing a friend

Questions? Contact Marina at marina.islas@austintexas.gov

title: Banned Book Film Fest: A Wrinkle in Time
body: Join us for a family screening of a film based on a banned book. Prepare to travel across time and space with A Wrinkle in Time (2018), based on the award-winning novel that was banned in some places for "promoting the occult." After the movie, stick around to discuss the film and the current state of book challenges. This movie is rated PG and runs for 109 minutes. Recommended for ages 9 and up.

title: Terrariums at Terrazas
body:
L﻿earn how to make a terrarium and learn a little bit about how the ecosystem works both inside and outside the jar!

Attendees will make their own terrariums with supplies and plant provided.

  • The first 25 registered attendees will get a half-gallon glass jar for their terrarium.
  • Other attendees will get smaller jars to use depending on available supplies.
  • Attendees can also bring their own clean glass jars, up to a half-gallon in size, to use for the program.

Due to limited supplies families will be limited to 1 terrarium per household.
field_event_summary: Make your first ecosystem in a jar while we walk you through the steps of making a terrarium!

title: Baila! A Collection of Latin Dance Lessons
body:
Latin dance reveals the ancient traditions of Latino culture as well as its history of emigration and adaptation. Offering an outlet for rhythmic expression and flowing movements, Latin dance incorporates a number of styles, including bachata, cumbia, reggaetón, salsa, and merengue.  Come watch and learn with Corazon Latino at the Library.

La danza latina revelan tradiciones ancestrales de esta cultura y habla también de su  historia de emigración y adaptación. Esta danza incorporan diversos estilos que incluyen la bachata, la cumbia, el reggaetón, la salsa y el merengue, los cuales ofrecen un conducto  para  expresiones rítmicas y movimientos fluidos. Le invitamos a las demostraciones y clases de bailes latinos ofrecidos en la Biblioteca a través de la organización Corazon Latino.

Este programa es presentado en inglés. Si necesita un intérprete, por favor solicítelo en este número: 512-974-7400.

title: Arthouse Films at Terrazas - Missing (1982)
body:
This September marks the 50th anniversary of the September 11, 1973 Chilean coup d'état. The U.S. supported military coup violently overthrew the democratic government of Chile installing a dictatorship that lasted 16 years

In commemoration, Terrazas Branch Library will be screening the1982 Palm d'Or winner "Missing"  directed by Costa-Gavras.

"A film based on the disappearance of journalist Charles Horman. A father searches for his missing son during the oppressive and violent political chaos of the 1973 Chilean coup. Seeking help from local bureau of the U.S. State Department, family frustration grows as the situation becomes more complex."

title: Arthouse Films at Terrazas
body:
Join us for a captivating evening of Arthouse Films as we delve into the thought-provoking film "Missing" (1982)

This September is the 50th anniversary of the Chilean coup d'état of 1973. September 11, 1973 - The Chilean military violently overthrew the democratic government of Chile installing a dictatorship that lasted 16 years.

title: Heartsong Music presents Music Together
body: Heartsong Music presents Music Together the early childhood music and movement program for children from birth through grade two and the adults who love them. Children of all ages can discover their inner music-makers through musical play!

title: Controversy & Conversation – Memories of a Dreamer
body:
September 2023 marks the 50th anniversary of the September 11th 1973 military coup in Chile that inaugurated a 17 year long military dictatorship.

Come watch a screening of the 2008 documentary “Memories of a Dreamer: The Journey of a Political Prisoner.”

“A firsthand account of the hardship suffered by a political prisoner of Chile's cruel 1973 and inhumane dictatorship. More than 30 years after, Félix Mora relives the shocking details of the human rights abuses he suffered, his escape from the dictatorship, and the challenges he faced as an exile in Italy and Canada.” *

After the film there will be a discussion between the audience and a discussant with insight on the film's subject matter.**

To learn more about topics related to this month's film make sure to explore this resource list.

2023 marks the 10th anniversary of Controversy & Conversation, a film series brought to you by Austin Public Library's Terrazas Branch. 

* (from the Official Documentary Website.)

** (discussant is TBA)

title: Bilingual Yoga (Spanish)
body: Gentle Flow (Ages 8+): Body, mind and soul will align as we move with intention through gentle movement guided by breath. We will incorporate meditation to regulate the nervous system.
